name: ListAutomationActionRunners
description:
Retrieve a list of Automation Action runners.

This tool retrieves a list of Automation Action runners sorted by runner name in alphabetical order. It should be called when you need information about available automation runners from Pagerduty.

parameters.name: accept_versioning_header
parameters.description: The versioning header for the API request, used in the 'Accept' field.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the response data. Must be set to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: maximum_results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of Automation Action runners to retrieve. This is the lesser of the provided value or the API's maximum limit.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination through results. Use value from `next_cursor` of previous request or omit to start from the beginning.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: filter_by_runner_name
parameters.description: Filters results to include runners with names matching the provided substring (case insensitive).

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the name (case insensitive substring matching)

parameters.name: additional_data_inclusion
parameters.description: An array of strings specifying additional data elements to include in the response.

value_schema.description: Includes additional data elements into the response

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the name (case insensitive substring matching)

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the name (case insensitive substring matching)

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Includes additional data elements into the response

value_schema.description: Includes additional data elements into the response

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
